text:
A blanket mutes/ Parts of the hillside/ Patterned in dark/ Green spades,/ Sprinkled with purple/ Morning-glory blooms./

Leaning down to/ The river, shadows/ Dealt cool passages./

Once homes, now ruins/ Lay beneath./

The stubborn base of/ A chimney rises/ To a covered dome./

One roof nearby/ Staves off the ivy mass./ Its rusted and ribbed/ Steel sheets/ Are carefully layered./

Itâ€™s getting past dusk/ And no one inside/ Has turned on a light./
